Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 05:53AM mrsb wrote: LOrena what you are feeling is perfectly normal. I remember the first weeks after mastectomy and reconstruction were very difficult.I was well prepared I thought for the ramifications of surgery but I too had sad crying periods  it seemed to be worse at night when I was tired,Gradually you will come to accept this new body of yours and as the reconstructed breast continued to evolve with nipples and tattoos the more I accepted my new breasts. Now this is just my body..my husbands thinks my new breast is fabulous.I am 5 1/2 year survivor and when I look at my body I do not see the scars. I see just my beautiful whole body.This journey does get easier ;Best wishes Mrs b
Posts.Title: Identity and late-night tears LorenaB cp418

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 04:20PM mrsb wrote: After 5 years I have finally  had my suspicions confirmed I have stage 1 of the affected arm, it is present in the upper arm and shoulder and in lat flap. The Le therapist says it is highly treatable and  will likely need a different kind of sleeve that goes across the shoulder.She thinks i will likely only need for excercise. Has anyone used these? Most of the time  the LE hasn't been a problem as I wear my sleeve for excrcise and flying and it responds quite nicely to rest.. no obvuious swelling but the arm gets heavy and achy and only this past plane trip did I get sweelling in my back which convinced me that it was LE. She feels with a few sessions with her I should be able to manage well with doing my own massage. i took a friend with me to the consultation and she said I was practically purring while tthe therapist was doing the massage.... As usual thiese thread has been very helpful.Thanks Mrs B
Posts.Title: How do I know if this is lymphedema joanne_elizabeth mrsb

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2008 06:35AM mrsb wrote: Thanks everyone. I always felt that i had sub clinical lymphodema from day 1 but was able to manage it with  intermittent use of sleeve and elevation. Everyone just said I had a frozen shoulder with arthritis  but things definitely changred when i came back from Florida this year,, area above lat flap wwas swollen, trunck was swollen ..had to keep my bra off for a week so it was evident to me that there had been progression. The over the shoulder sleeve was somenting the MLD therapist thought might be helpful but she too isn't convinced I need to use sleeve for more than excecise.She is optimistic that i won't have to get into wrapping and stuff so am I. I usually resposnd to massage therapy  of other parts of my body quickly and in a sustained manner so I am hoping that I will with MLD. Yes my freind did take notes and will come to a session to learn it herself as will my husband. I have been fortunate that I have followed  the LE threads here since diagnosis so am well versed in the prevention of infections,not using my at risk arm  for ivs etc etc All the best Mrs B
Posts.Title: How do I know if this is lymphedema joanne_elizabeth mrsb

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 07:06PM mrsb wrote: Hi I was diagnosed with microcalcifications  almost 6 years ago I wasn't part of the 80%. if the 2nd mamogram is abnormal they will recommend a core biopsy .There is areally good info here on microcalcifications. Hang in there the chances are in your favour. see if you can get a prescribtion for ativan to help you sleep till you have more info. Good luck
Posts.Title: Please help, just joined LB2008 Dukemom2

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2009 02:20PM mrsb wrote: what a good daughtger you are.I am with Tami be there for her.lots of hugs and i love yous help.My daughter helped me with my research too.
Posts.Title: Worried about my mother swatty8464 mrsb

Posts.Content: May 11, 2010 06:49PM mrsb wrote: Hi I am a 7 year survivor with stage 2 with 2 micromets. I had a mastectomy with immediate recosntruction due to mulifocal diease although my tumour was tiny.I did not have chemotherapy as i was that time very sick with myocarditis and pericartidis and heart failure( so the risk out weighed the benefits) however I did have radiotherapy and have been on tamoxefen for 9mths then switched to arimedex followed byFemara  none of these medciatons failed but i had to change due to side effects. I am now  past my 7 year and still in Femara by choice. I reveived some excellant advise at the beginin of my journey (throw everyting you can at eh beast)  from the start.Good luck
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2009 08:50AM mrsb wrote: I had my expander put back  in after 2 years without problems . I had mild LE of chest and upper arm and shoulder. did same without incident.although I  took lots of precautions... l ceansed skin for 3 days with antiseptic lotion, antibiotics before and after.I wasn' t having treatment( MLA) then but i would have a session before surgery.My PS was wonderful and understanding  and saw me every week for almost 6 weeks as I was very anxuious about losing this my 3rd expander.I just this week had my tattoing done this week and did the same protocol with the addition of a session of MLd first..looking good.Finally at 6 1/2 years i am done(i had the tatto artist do a little work on my other aerola to see if we could get a better match. Shelagh
Posts.Title: Reconstruct after LE? inspiewriter inspiewriter

Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2007 09:06AM mrsb wrote: I had a lumpectomy a nd it wasn't awfully  painful. I think at that point i was exausted from lack of sleep, worry and full of the what ifs.I was in the middle of waiiting for biospy results etc and waiting  for surgery during the christmas period and it was difficult to cope with.Fast forward 5 years and I am well,blessed for all the good things that have come my way.The waiting is hard but as RoseQ says it will come together. Mrs B
Posts.Title: waiting for my operation date jeanettee jeanettee

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2008 11:25PM mrsb wrote: My PS over overinflated me prior to Rads which seems to be the norm. Unfortunately I could feel a difference in the expander from 2nd Rads treatment(tightness then shrinkage). I did go on to lose the expander to capsular contraction 9 mths later.I had problems with infection on one exchange but I am still here  and healthy 5 + years. So it all worked out in the end and I have a beautifully reconstructed breast.Your Rad oncologist  should know what to do. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Expander Conflicts with Radiation Success? Dragonfly92127 mrsb

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2008 04:21PM mrsb wrote: it does get better. once the back drain out it is a little more comfortable .It took me about 2 weeks to get off pain medication and once i had the ok i visited a phsysio who helped me with my excecise.Mrs B
Posts.Title: latissimus flap and expanders mittmott Kathy_K

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2008 11:29AM mrsb wrote: I know I was daignosed with IDC after 4 years on Estrace. My annual  mamograms were normal then suddely claicifications.....aggressive . I am convinced that the HRT played a big part as I am estrogen Positive but on other hand maybe i wouldnt have been so goood about my annual mammogrmas if not on hrt.Mrs b
Posts.Title: HRT Risk? MinAZ Jellydonut

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2010 04:14PM mrsb wrote:  I was diagnosed in 2003 ,I had 2 micromets in axilla nodes i had mastectomy and radation,due to micromets and the fact that my oncologist wanted to dose the subcalvian nodes. I did not have  chemo due to prior cardiac problems..(the risks outweighed the benefits). I am 7 years NED and by choise am still on Femara.Myself and my oncologist took the micromets very seriuosly and I am glad we did.
